smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain valid elements and content; no empty diagrams were found.

All top-level use cases are associated with actors. Included use cases (e.g., 'Vaata kõiki ootel...') are reachable via the actors associated with the base use cases ('Aktiveeri auto', 'Muuda auto mitteaktiivseks').
No distinct use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found.

The package diagram (Page 1) contains distinct package names. While 'Isik' appears as both a Class (Page 6) and a Table (Page 14), these are on separate diagrams representing different views (Logical vs Data) and do not appear as duplicates within the same single package diagram context.

Data structures are normalized. Common attributes like 'nimetus' (Name) or timestamps ('reg_aeg') in different tables ('Auto', 'Isik') represent different data specific to those entities, not redundant denormalization. Relationships are properly established via Foreign Keys (e.g., FK_riik_kood).
Naming is consistent. All use cases begin with an imperative verb in Estonian (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri', 'Muuda', 'Lõpeta').
In the State Diagram (Page 9), all states ('Ootel', 'Unustatud', 'Aktiivne', 'Mitteaktiivne', 'Lõpetatud') are reachable from the Start node via defined transitions.
In the Activity Diagram (Page 4), all actions and decisions are reachable from the Start node ('Alg').
All visible relationships on class and data diagrams include multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1).
No single diagram exceeds the limit of 10 central elements. The densest diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables, which is within the allowed limit.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram. The maximum observed is 5 connections (e.g., 'Isik' on Page 6 connects to 5 elements including role associations).
Diagram layouts are balanced, with no element placed excessively far (more than twice the average distance) from its related elements.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
All class, table, attribute, and use case names exceed 3 characters. Shortest standard names found are 4 characters (e.g., 'Riik', 'Isik', 'Auto').
All class names start with an Uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
All attributes and columns start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_aeg', 'nimetus').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
No inappropriate type prefixes were found. Prefixes like 'PK', 'FK', 'pfK' are used strictly for key constraints as permitted by the rule.
